content.question: A cart carrying sand has a hole in the bottom that allows sand to spill out. At time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, the cart has speed <math alttext="1.5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1.5</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. A short time later at time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, the cart still has speed <math alttext="1.5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math> but <math alttext="0.02 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.02</mn><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>kg</mtext></mstyle></math> of sand has fallen out of the hole in the cart between <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is the magnitude of the change in momentum of the cart and its contents between <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?
